Source code for content.models

from django.db import models
from datetime import date
from .utils import video_upload_path, thumbnail_upload_path
from django.db.models.signals import post_save
from .validators import ValidateFileSize, validate_jpeg_file

# Create your models here.


[docs]
class GenreModel(models.Model):
    name = models.CharField(max_length=255, unique=True)
    
    class Meta:
        verbose_name = "Genre"
        verbose_name_plural = "Genres"
        
    def __str__(self):
        return self.name






[docs]
class VideoModel(models.Model):
    
    created_at = models.DateField(default=date.today)
    title = models.CharField(max_length=255)
    description = models.CharField(max_length=500)
    video_file = models.FileField(upload_to=video_upload_path, blank=True, null=True)
    genres = models.ManyToManyField(GenreModel, related_name='videos')
    thumbnail_img = models.ImageField(upload_to=thumbnail_upload_path, blank=True, null=True, validators=[validate_jpeg_file, ValidateFileSize(0.3)])
    
    class Meta:
        verbose_name = "Video"
        verbose_name_plural = "Videos"
    
    def __str__(self):
        return f'{self.id} - {self.title}'
    


[docs]
    def save(self, *args, **kwargs):
        is_new = self.id is None

        if not self.id:
            saved_video_file = self.video_file
            saved_thumbnail_file = self.thumbnail_img
            self.video_file = None  
            self.thumbnail_img = None
            super().save(*args, **kwargs)  
            self.video_file = saved_video_file 
            self.thumbnail_img = saved_thumbnail_file
            super().save(update_fields=['video_file', 'thumbnail_img'])
        else:
            super().save(*args, **kwargs)
        
        if is_new:
            post_save.send(sender=self.__class__, instance=self, created=True)
